reviewText: Far Cry 3 was a very, very good game.  With Far Cry 4, Ubisoft took a 'it isn't broke, so don't try to fix it' approach, taking 3, transporting it to a more mountainous area, and giving it a new story and new protagonist, plus one or two other little tweaks and features.  Primal is a little bit more of a departure, with the lack of vehicles, a beast taming function, and a basic village building bit that ties into an expanded crafting and skill set, but it is Ubisoft doing this again, so it's basically what you'd expect from Far Cry in 10,000BCE.  This isn't really a bad thing, per se, but, if you're expecting something radically different and new, this isn't it.

reviewText:
Most bad reviews come from people who can't even start the game which is a pretty big issue but it shouldn't affect the review of the game itself.

Most FC veterans are saying that this game is more of the same nothing new but a lot less, taking this into consideration i bought primal and i have 0 regrets at the momment. The world feels huge and the atmosphere is just perfect you'll often find people from your tribe minding their own business, maybe you'll catch a glimpse of two predators beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of each other.

While it's true combat can get a little repetitive you can use traps, bombs, owl ambushes, jaguar silent kills and even more stuff to make the experience better, you could just grab a club or a spear and stomp your way through the game but come on what's the fun on that?

One small complain i have is the wildlife feels a little lacking so if by any chance there is DLC planned for this i really hope they add at the very least 5-10 animals, because the stone age had a lot fo amazing animals that could have added even more mechanics to FC Primal.

I recommend it to FC newbies just like me, because it seems veterans aren't getting anything worth their while.

reviewText: All but one time that I loaded the game did it come up with a warning screen concerning epilepsy, at which point the game crashed. The one time I got into the game, I was able to play about 15 minutes or so, which seemed okay enough. However, I had to exit and go to work, and it hasn't worked since then. I have since followed the steps offered by the developer's representative in the forums, and absolutely nothing has changed. People say a lot of bad things about Ubisoft, but until this, I was willing to look past complaints about their business practices and their games' content etc, because I really enjoyed Far Cry 3, Far Cry 3 Blood Dragon, Far Cry 4, Beyond Good & Evil 2, the Prince of Persia games, and many more. However, they're one of the big name brands, and they've put out a game that doesn't work properly.\n\nThis is a game I have paid full retail price for, and it does not function despite obviously meeting the system requirements (I played on high settings just fine that one time it worked). Quite a few users are having this problem. A significant number of players who appear to have gotten it to function report performance issues making the game unenjoyable as well. I am extremely disappointed with Ubisoft. Please avoid this game at least until (if) they fix it. I will be refunding my purchase in a few days if no fix has been provided, and if it comes to that, I am seriously considering no longer purchasing Ubisoft titles until they have been out for months to be properly patched and discounted, because I shouldn't have to put up with this when I am paying them full price for their game.
voteText: 6 of 14 people (43%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I enjoy this game.  It's beautiful and stunning visually.  Beyond that I enjoy how the night/day phases altered my game play.

At night, predators come out.  Wolves roam the forest and this is all best taken in without a torch.  Let the starlight and moonlight shine down upon the area.  Then notice the sillhouettes of predators, probably wolves, roaming around.  Listen to the sounds around you as the predators hunt down their prey.  Know that you, are a human, at a time when you were part of this food chain, and not standing atop the guns that put you at the top.

I love that this game makes you rethink how you would do a few things because this is a time before even ancient conveniences.  You're part of a tribe of humans that have to fight to survive.  Part of me thought about how awesome it was to not have to pay taxes or rent, but then I remembered that pretty much everything wants to kill them, so maybe it wasnt so nice.

Either way, I like it.

reviewText:
Most bad reviews come from people who can't even start the game which is a pretty big issue but it shouldn't affect the review of the game itself.

Most FC veterans are saying that this game is more of the same nothing new but a lot less, taking this into consideration i bought primal and i have 0 regrets at the momment. The world feels huge and the atmosphere is just perfect you'll often find people from your tribe minding their own business, maybe you'll catch a glimpse of two predators beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of each other.

While it's true combat can get a little repetitive you can use traps, bombs, owl ambushes, jaguar silent kills and even more stuff to make the experience better, you could just grab a club or a spear and stomp your way through the game but come on what's the fun on that?

One small complain i have is the wildlife feels a little lacking so if by any chance there is DLC planned for this i really hope they add at the very least 5-10 animals, because the stone age had a lot fo amazing animals that could have added even more mechanics to FC Primal.

I recommend it to FC newbies just like me, because it seems veterans aren't getting anything worth their while.

voteText: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Hello fellow explorers. I say that primarily because that is what most people who play sandbox games are though some of us like to shoot our guns/bows or swing our swords/clubs more than others. Ubisoft Montreal has crafted a beautiful land for you to explore and conquer. It's filled with danger at every turn, until with a little time and a few prehistoric beasts; you can stride the land like a confident apex predator. The abilities of all the critters vary and give you ways to spice up what has become a standard in the Far Cry series; taking outposts. There are dozens of ways to occupy your time in Oros apart from that standard, and a large variety of mission types can be played or not just like FC 2, 3, and 4. Ubisoft continues to polish this series and find ways to add to the variety of options in which you can conquer your stone age world.
I have read a number of reviews that bemoan the lack of multiplayer and a cohesive compelling storyline. I have told a friend, that for myself I would have loved there to have been a coop campaign like FC4, but alas instead we get a highly polished singleplayer game instead. I prefer that dedication to honing the SP experience over trying to mash in a multiplayer mode and both SP and MP suffering for it, I wish more companies would take note of what Ubisoft has been doing with the Far Cry series.
As to the story. A stone age era is exactly that. Stone age. Languages are not overly expressive, there is no wealth of history for characters to rely on, only oral histories. Human interaction at that level of development would be just as infantile and primordial as the technology said cavemen are using. I mean the wheel hasn't even been invented yet and cannibalism is rampant, so what makes people think there would be some super complex emotional rollercoaster of a narrative?
I've played all the Far Cry games, and the stories have never been OMG make a movie out of that!"
recommended: and so is the simplistic tale of a tribe's struggle for survival and the need to evolve that was presented in this game. For me this title fires on all cylinders and delivers exactly what one would expect. A great romp through the year 10
hoursPlayed: 000 BC with a plethora of weapons
voteText: tools
helpfulPercent: and tactics at your disposal to make any style of playthrough possible.\n8/10 for me
votesHelpful: with the minus two points for no multiplayer or announced plans for it.\nA word to the wise Ubisoft
votesTotal: take what you have done and make a DLC that adds something of merit for once. A multiplayer campaign expansion that is unlocked after you beat the game in singleplayer that features a whole new tribe invading the land of Oros."

reviewText:
I am not sure why people are hating on this game. It's a refreshing game in the sense that it isn't the norm. Without the sniper rifles, grenades, explosions, etc, it changes the way you play. I hardly ever play stealthy, yet in this one there is something extremely satisfying with sneaking around and doing a Takedown on enemies.

I haven't had any game crashes like others have, and I play it on max settings. I usually get between 50-60 fps. I do however, use EVGA Precision X in the background, and lower my clocks by 50mhz. This has solved many a game crashing for me. Previously unplayable games due to crashes are fixed by using Precision X. So for those having trouble with the crashes, try Precision X. Make sure to open it, set the profile, then close it and reopen it (the profile will automatically be there). If you don't do that then some keys might not work (Like Ctrl+Right arrow, and in some shooters Ctrl is crouch).

This game is their best one yet in regards to gameplay and style. I love being in the stone age and not having an arsenal of guns and rocket launchers. The wildlife of the world constantly attack you (unless you use a pet to ward them off) and there are many random encounters with the enemies, just like previous Far Cry games. Gathering is a bit easier than previous games, in my opinion.

The story is a little short and lacking compared to Far Cry 4, for example. That doesn't take away from the game though, at least not for me. For those on the fence, get the game if you like Far Cry games. People complaining are either stuck up gaming snobs, or are quick to hate a game. As far as this being a copy+paste of other Far Cry games, it isn't. It does take a lot of aspects in terms of abilities from Far Cry 4, then expands upon them. This is always done with games that release newer ones (Far Cry 2 > Far Cry 3 > Far Cry4).

There are some bugs, which I hate. I would rather a game gets delayed and has less bugs. The two that mainly ♥♥♥♥ me off is sometimes when my pet needs healing, it won't register me next to it and I can't heal. Another is the Climb option. Sometimes you will be right there and unless the Climb appears on the screen, he won't grab on.

The game gets a solid 8.5 for me. Worth it in my opinion.

**Also if you think the bows are too weak, then get a headshot. It's not their fault you can't aim properly**

reviewText:
ok where to start with this game

first off its very visually pleasing, and runs much better than the previous games that i used to get 40/45fps maxed out and now with this game i can get 50/60fps with no change in hardware so at that fact i am very pleased.(fx 8350--gtx 970--8gb ram)

as far as gameplay is concerned, there is much to do in this game and although i do think that the taming shouldnt be so simplistic and easy i do think it warrants merit. now to the map, IT.. IS..MASSIVE. took me a good while to even traverse a quarter of the terrain just to get to a mission so thats a bonus and paired with the true fog of war you really dont know what to expect.

now to combat, the combat in this game is more of an aquired taste because nearly every projectile the enemy can launch at you can be dodged with ease by using some pretty simple sidestepping and even with melee combat unless your playing on a harder difficulty is just to easy. the real danger are the animals, mostly they are fighting between each other but if they arent then it can become a problem. if you see 2 bears and get to close they will chase for the kill and they are fast and if you accidentily run into an eagle in the process of running away then your pretty f****d lol.

so my verdict is 7/10 great game and visually pleasing but could use some improvements to the combat and taming.

reviewText: I love this game. It takes my three favorite things from prior Far Cry games (hunting, crafting and bow & arrow fighting) and expands on all of them. Game has ran flawlessly on my system. Sure, it re-uses some elements from prior Far Cry's like  outposts and side quest formats. The time setting is a breath of fresh air. voteText: 3 of 8 people (38%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
The badger is a phoenix 10/10

Legitimately though:

Simply, this game is phenomenal.

There are very few games I would list as 'Masterpeices', by which I mean that they not only define but alos entirely a genre or theme. To this date my only other 'Masterpiece' is Red Dead Redemption. This game is exactly everything you could ever want from a game about the struggles of primitive man. The prevelent themes of which I mean the importance of the alliance between Man and animals (primarily man and wolf but thats less important given story elements), the presence of Neanderthals in the evolution of man (their defeat/ultimate integration) and the importance of religion in the development of mankind. I'll admit I have a level of bias given my personal preferance to the major themes and their design choice of trying to adhere to history (or prehistory as it might be) as much as possible for example referring to linguistics professionals for the language and likewise for how weapons and clothings and such resembled what they had back then. So as to be expected the plot is simple though it is more than enough fleshed out by the backstory of the cultures involved and as such I found it very fulfilling (despite and including the nuances) in the plot department.

That being said (spoiler warning kinda) there are only three catagories of weapons the Club, the Bow and the Spear though all three of which are versatile and varied enough to be satisfing in their own way. Clubbing someone and wantching them ragdoll away is just as satisfying as watching someone cop an arrow to the face and collapse to the ground. And that all separate from watching the tamed animal takedowns or the owl kill people.

If your looking for Far Cry 4 then perhaps look elsewhere as more than a few people have mentioned the lack of weapons and vehicles make them unhappy, though riding animals was more than an adequate replacement and the weapon variations was more than enough to keep my attention and interest. If you want as accurate an experience as you'll ever get to an engaging experience of what it was like to be primitive man then this is exactly what you should buy. Personally, the weapons, gameplay, mission and animals were all very exciting and fulfilling including the very tongue in cheek character Urki. That all being said its very much a Far Cry game, if you like pulling your thumb back in place then with a satisfying snap and pop or a varied cast of weird and interesting characters and their subsequent development then you'll be more than pleased.

I could not speak enough about how much I enjoyed this game and I have waited since it was announced as DLC for Far Cry 3. I'm not even a Far Cry fanboy, I have yet to even buy number 4 and this game blew me away. Please buy this game!!!!!!

In regards to other reviews about the game, my firewall and computer never had a single iota of issue with the game. My comp is an average gaming rig from 2008 and it runs it almost perfectly on High (aside from a second or two of lag as I spawn in) and it looks superb! Breathtaking even if you take the time to just look around at the gorgeous scenery.

Legitimate rating: 10/10

reviewText:
First of, stop giving the game a bad rating if YOU can't run it.

Now that that's off my chest, i can start the actual review.

Lets start with some pros and cons

Pros:
Great setting
a great combat system
cool and diverse weapons
atmospheric music
you can ride a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ mammoth
ok story
cool characters
decent graphics
the village building/ weapon upgrading systems are well integrated
day and night cyckle
a lot of different animals and beasts
all in all a metric f***ton of stuff to do

Cons:
It got a good amout of glitches
sometimes a wier animation for when a spear is stuck in an enemy
some people can't run it

Now let's talk about the game as a whole:

when i first played the game, i really felt like i was on the bottom of the food chain. each time an enemy showed up on the radar i would try to hide in fear. sadly, this only lasts for around the first hour, whereafter you will feel comfortable to fight Dholes and wolves. But the feeling will come back to you, when you try take down your first so called tigri"
date: or when you get hunted through the regions by wooly rhinos and aggressive mammoths.\n\nThe story itself is pretty basic
recommended: but when you're put into the situation that the protagonist Takkar is put in
hoursPlayed: it makes the story so much better. Both the ongoing fight with Ull
voteText: leader of the cannibalistic Udam
helpfulPercent: and the one with Batari
votesHelpful: queen of the sun people.\n\nAll in all

votesFunny: and gives the game a solid 8

reviewText: Primal is definitely a step up from Far Cry 4. Far Cry 4 felt like a deja vu of Far Cry 3 in a different environment. Primal lets you play the series in a new inovative way like never seen before. The idea of taming beasts lets you approach the series in way never seen before.  Although it may still feel like a Far Cry game with the capturing of outposts and stuff it definitely has its new formula implemented in it. Might feel like you've dont this before with a gun in your hand, but the game definitely pulls you into its world of non stop action with never a dull moment. The game definitely delivers its addictive playstyle to its fullest. Worth every cent of that $60.

reviewText:
I read about alot of problems, but no problems here so far.
No fps drops, no stutters or other issues.
I've only played 3 hours ofcourse so i might run into something, but so far, very smooth ride.

I also like it alot better compared to the previous games, maybe i got tired of guns.
The animals attacking alot, is reduced compared to farcry 4 (eagle watch out EAGLEEEE.. ffs), which is a good thing, as it sucked alot as a game mechanic.

Other Animals can be avoided by crouching or keeping your distance / waving fire at them, depending on the type of animal.

Graphics look good, the story.. uh yeh you dont play this for the story.
Sound, well there is one important issue with it : music has no seperate volume slider, so all you get is 1 master volume control..
Music can be too loud at times, so thats annoying.

This game is played by yours truly on windows 10 : i7 5820k, gtx980, 16gb DDR4 settings : very high. (avoid ultra as it consumed to much vram for some reason)
gtx980 drivers 359.00, for me they seem to be extremely stable incl. for new released games which i always tend to buy.

reviewText:
Not a full review yet because I barely got to play, but I noticed so many reviewers having issues with the game.

I was able to load and benchmark the game fine Tuesday morning without updating the latest nvidia drivers. At night I updated drivers and I was able to play the intro part of the game without a hitch. I don't think the latest drivers helped my benchmark score.

I have a 780ti and 3570k. I'm able to play at ~70 fps on high settings, and ~50 fps on very high to ultra settings(in the benchmark). I have a 1080/144hz monitor and the game allows you to set the max refresh(up to 144hz) which is a poor mans gsync. The graphics look on par with other games released in the last year.

I'll try to update my review as I play the game more.

reviewText:
Primal is by far the best open world game I have ever played! And I play hardly anything else...
Red Dead redemtion was fantastic as a WIld West open world.. primal is just as great for the 10.000bc setting.

But you have to love the setting of 10K bc!! If you dont play 3 or 4 or GTAV

However if you like the idea of being a caeman - oh boy you are in for a TREAT! THis game is so amazingly well crafted and immersive it transfers me into a kid on christmas eve.

I play on the hardest setting and it is a joy, I have disabled the minimap and dont even use the map I just roam around the gorgeous wilderness... and boy does the sound design kick ♥♥♥ and create an experince like no other...
It is fun to hunt with just a bow and a Spear... it fells just about perfect... the sun or the moonlight coming through the leaves its just amazing.

I have 2 980ms and play with gsync on with a steady 60fps with no drops... Ultra settings just lowered shadows to high"
works smooth as butter that way...

I deeply recomend this for people that like the setting... it is actually my faivorite Ubisoft game of all time and runner up would be Black Flag - which created an amazing Pirate setting.."

reviewText:
What can I say about Far Cry Primal:
1) How about that besides a small issue with the activation code at the start (which easily resolved with a quick computer restart), I have had no problems with the game at all. Running very smooth with max settings.
2) Like others have said before, you have to remember it is a Far Cry game in many ways.

date: you can then decide to change it up or go do some other quest or hunt.\n5) Perhaps a bit expensive now. If that deters you

reviewText:
This is not an actual review of the game as I haven't played enough of it; I just want to report my experience regarding the game's performance.

I installed the game on 3 computers. My main rig, AMD FX-8350, 16Gb RAM, SSD, GTX 980, running the game on ultra settings, 1440p; my media PC, AMD FX-6300, 8Gb RAM, HDD, GTX 770, high settings, 1080p; and my laptop, i7-4710HQ, 16Gb RAM, HDD, GTX 860M, medium-high settings, 1080p.

I didn't get any error messages nor crashes on any of my systems. Performance is overall playable: got 50-60 FPS on my main and media PCs, and 40-50 on my laptop. The framerate does drop to 30 sometimes for no apparent reason, but it's occasional and thankfully doesn't last more than 3-4 seconds.

Is the game well-optimized? Nope. Far Cry 4 runs at a better framerate, has better-looking graphics and doesn't hiccup as much as this one. But Primal's performance, while not great, is not horrible. All things considered, it's very playable.

So, should you buy this game? Well,  I only gave a positive recommendation because it worked for me and I personally don't mind the performance issues all that much.  It's a bit of a roll of the dice when it comes to getting the errors, but either I got very lucky (game worked on 3 very different systems) or chances are most people won't get them. Now, if you're not in a hurry you can always wait a month or two until everything is smoothed out (I'd wait until the Summer Sale in that case). But if you REALLY want to play it now, give it a try, my guess is you probably won't struggle a lot with it. And if you do, thankfully you can always ask for a refund.

reviewText: Primal is definitely a step up from Far Cry 4. Far Cry 4 felt like a deja vu of Far Cry 3 in a different environment. Primal lets you play the series in a new inovative way like never seen before. The idea of taming beasts lets you approach the series in way never seen before.  Although it may still feel like a Far Cry game with the capturing of outposts and stuff it definitely has its new formula implemented in it. Might feel like you've dont this before with a gun in your hand, but the game definitely pulls you into its world of non stop action with never a dull moment. The game definitely delivers its addictive playstyle to its fullest. Worth every cent of that $60.

reviewText:
I read about alot of problems, but no problems here so far.
No fps drops, no stutters or other issues.
I've only played 3 hours ofcourse so i might run into something, but so far, very smooth ride.

I also like it alot better compared to the previous games, maybe i got tired of guns.
The animals attacking alot, is reduced compared to farcry 4 (eagle watch out EAGLEEEE.. ffs), which is a good thing, as it sucked alot as a game mechanic.

Other Animals can be avoided by crouching or keeping your distance / waving fire at them, depending on the type of animal.

Graphics look good, the story.. uh yeh you dont play this for the story.
Sound, well there is one important issue with it : music has no seperate volume slider, so all you get is 1 master volume control..
Music can be too loud at times, so thats annoying.

This game is played by yours truly on windows 10 : i7 5820k, gtx980, 16gb DDR4 settings : very high. (avoid ultra as it consumed to much vram for some reason)
gtx980 drivers 359.00, for me they seem to be extremely stable incl. for new released games which i always tend to buy.

reviewText:
Not a full review yet because I barely got to play, but I noticed so many reviewers having issues with the game.

I was able to load and benchmark the game fine Tuesday morning without updating the latest nvidia drivers. At night I updated drivers and I was able to play the intro part of the game without a hitch. I don't think the latest drivers helped my benchmark score.

I have a 780ti and 3570k. I'm able to play at ~70 fps on high settings, and ~50 fps on very high to ultra settings(in the benchmark). I have a 1080/144hz monitor and the game allows you to set the max refresh(up to 144hz) which is a poor mans gsync. The graphics look on par with other games released in the last year.

I'll try to update my review as I play the game more.

reviewText:
[UPDATE]
I just spent all day playing. Got 16.5 hours under my belt now. It gets better. Storyline is all kinds of generic and the characters are unrelatable but I never imagined a caveman game other than Joe & Mac being so good. The gotta catch em all pokemon crap they threw in is actually pretty awesome and time consuming.

Also to clarify I do recommend the game but honestly I'd wait for it to drop in price. If you absolutely have no other games to play and you're craving some game time then this game will probably satisfy that itch. If you're a completionist it will probably last you 20 to 30 hours from the rate I've been progressing.

[ORIGINAL FIRST IMPRESSION]
Been playing for almost 3 hours now. Game is okay I guess although taking guns and vehicles out of Far Cry might not have been the best idea on Ubisoft's part. The graphics are not nearly as impressive as I thought they'd be for a next gen game. I don't know if they downgraded the graphics to hit 60 FPS on consoles but my Titan X is chewing through this game maxed out at 1440p despite the benchmark showing drops to 50 FPS. So far the gameplay has consisted of gathering supplies, killing animals, upgrading stuff, killing people, doing mission, repeat. I'll add more later when I've played a bit further into the story but as of right now I'd suggest people wait for a price drop before taking this trip back to 10,000 BCE. In my honest opinion Far Cry has been going downhill since 3. Ubisoft really needs to stop milking these titles for all their worth and come up with some new IPs with some fresh gameplay.

reviewText:
Pros: Far Cry Game to its core, really enjoying eveything it has to offer. Cannot put it down. The graphics aren't anything ultra beatiful, but my 4K monitor died and playing it on my 720p TV, but even with its slightly pixely worlded it is a pleasure to play. The crafting is back in full and has even more depth with its focus on hunting and gathering, to be honest I enjoy that more than its side missions. The characters while nothing new, have that same depth (crazyness) that I like to see.

Cons: 12 hours into the game, I cannot really find a story to it other than increasing the villages population. Having seen both the Udam's and the blue people's leaders, they don't have that same vibe as the 3 and 4 main villians. The mammoth missions suck in every possible definition. I dislike the owl and its controls. The only technically innovating thing is the ability to tame the animals, and I dislike it. Having played ARK Survival Evolved, I can honestly tell you, it never gives the same satisfactory, so I just play without using the wolves and the big cats. I do wish the weapons were a little stronger especially the long bow, as I tend to love playing the sniper class and think in such a way. It does crash ALOT and it does so in such a weird way that makes my TV not register the computer sending a signal to it.

In conclusion, I do recommend this game because for all its bad, I still cannot put it down...however you might  just wait a while until it goes on sale or another patch or two.

reviewText:
first of all, i was so inclined to buy this just because of the tamed beasts (kinda like pokemon but with cool looking animals). so this will be a bit of a biased review. the story or quest are pretty spread out and the land of oros is kinda big so you really need to ride a tamed beast to get finish all the quest. Without a rideable animal, it kinda gets boring just running around - heck even with riding one and going to your destination gets boring in a while, although its also just part of the game.

the storyline just follows through from one quest to another. It took me 35 hours just to conquer oros since i kept getting sidetracked with collectibles, sidequests, and gathering materials. ok, this happened a few times: i accept a tribal clash/help wenja quest and when i check the map, theres no destination marked as well as, obviously, getting the reward, which is what im after - skill points.

the crafting and skills part of the game really helps you finish quests with ease. thats why i always get those sidequests with skill point as a reward. i think you could finish the game a lot quicker than me if you just go through the main quests. thats just me though - going the long way.

The animals or also known as beasts are awesome. was stoked when i found out that you can ride one, boy was i glad too since it wont take me so long to get into my next destination. btw, not all animals are tameable - which sucks big time. the tameable ones are still awesome and be sure to check out their descriptions - some have interesting skills.

the characters.... hmmm, id say theyre all crazy. well, what else would you expect as the result of getting their home destroyed. since i cant understand a single thing their saying unless i read the subtitles, i just listen to my music instead.

my take is... if you like a little pokemon kind of adventure, id say go for it and spend a bit more!!! if not, the price is just too high for this kind of game

Bought the game on day one, didn't have any errors or fps lag. Worth the price.

reviewText:
Pros: Far Cry Game to its core, really enjoying eveything it has to offer. Cannot put it down. The graphics aren't anything ultra beatiful, but my 4K monitor died and playing it on my 720p TV, but even with its slightly pixely worlded it is a pleasure to play. The crafting is back in full and has even more depth with its focus on hunting and gathering, to be honest I enjoy that more than its side missions. The characters while nothing new, have that same depth (crazyness) that I like to see.

Cons: 12 hours into the game, I cannot really find a story to it other than increasing the villages population. Having seen both the Udam's and the blue people's leaders, they don't have that same vibe as the 3 and 4 main villians. The mammoth missions suck in every possible definition. I dislike the owl and its controls. The only technically innovating thing is the ability to tame the animals, and I dislike it. Having played ARK Survival Evolved, I can honestly tell you, it never gives the same satisfactory, so I just play without using the wolves and the big cats. I do wish the weapons were a little stronger especially the long bow, as I tend to love playing the sniper class and think in such a way. It does crash ALOT and it does so in such a weird way that makes my TV not register the computer sending a signal to it.

In conclusion, I do recommend this game because for all its bad, I still cannot put it down...however you might  just wait a while until it goes on sale or another patch or two.

reviewText:
Stunning to say the least!

I've 112 games in my Steam library (not counting Origin and other) and this is the only game so far I've played for more than 3 hours at first launch, because nothing has captivated me away from the relentless BF3 Multiplayer 64 player matches so far. Many might not understand that, but for me that's a big deal. It's now day 2 after purchase and I've been thinking about the game all night and even feel like missing work to play it (sadly I can't though).

The game itself is increadible atmospheric and I feel almost like being in the game for real. Of course some HUD features 'off' like mini map, object highlights/shimmering, objective on SMART, etc. to name but a few as well as hand holding weapon & melee assist (off!) then the game comes even more alive; just don't forget to turn the lights down as well. The feeling of being back at such a period in time is further accentuated with a slight heart pounding fear and tension I've not experienced for a while in a game - I actually felt like I was scared when hearing a bear growling nearby having seen how fast and powerful they are.

The scenery is super lush and completely believable. The physics, the control and feedback is exceptionally rewarding as well as the observable movements of all other life forms in the Primal kingdom as they stroll or scurry around. Initially one is drawn in so much that in the back of your mind as you get carried away, you kinda wish they thrown in a few Dinosaurs but at the same time realize that would be a mistake for the time period the games based in and is probably better for it's attempted historical accuracy.

This game is more of an experience than simply an observation and attempted interaction. Admittedly my setup helps me to enjoy that more sitting one meter away from a 42 1080p monitor with dual GTX970M SLI's running the game 60fps at High setting
date: using Xbox One Elite controller and last but not least and probably one of the most contributing factors a Sony Pulse headset for that added reverberation rumble type sub low end bass - i.e. in BF3 I use to just hear the tanks fire and Heli blades chop the air
recommended: but with the Sony Pulse headphones
hoursPlayed: I 'feel' the Heli blades chop the air and Tank shells letting rip as the sounds from the Sony Pulse's reverberate your skull; because a game is both a visual and sound experience I can honestly say that the these headphones are one off
voteText: if not the most prized accessories in a gaming setup as they make games become more alive (gave up HD25's for these)."
